ARABIC: وَٱذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَآ أَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّى مَسَّنِىَ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنُ بِنُصْبٍ وَعَذَابٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Remember Our slave Ayyub when he called on his Lord: 'Shaytan has afflicted me with exhaustion and suffering.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Remember Our votary Job because he called to his Lord: "Satan has afflicted me with disease and distress."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And remember Our servant Job: when he cried to his Lord: “Behold, Satan has afflicted me with much hardship and suffering.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad), recall Our servant Job. When he prayed to his Lord saying, "Satan has afflicted me with hardship and torment,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And remember Our bondman Ayyub (Job); when he cried out* to his Lord, “The devil has struck me with hardship and pain.” (After seven years of patience.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And remember Our servant Ayyub, when he invoked his Lord (saying): "Verily, Shaytan has afflicted me with distress and torment!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And remember Our servant Ayyub, when he called upon his Lord: The Shaitan has afflicted me with toil and torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Remember also Our servant Job; when he called to his Lord, 'Behold, Satan has visited me with weariness and chastisement.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And make mention (O Muhammad) of Our bondman Job, when he cried unto his Lord (saying): Lo! the devil doth afflict me with distress and torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Bring to mind Our servant Job who cried to his Lord, "Satan has afflicted me with distress and suffering."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And remember thou Our bondman Ayyub, what time he cried Unto his Lord: verily the Satan hath touched me with affliction and suffering.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And remember Our servant Job [in the Quran]. When he called out to his Lord, ‘The devil has visited on me hardship and torment,’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Commemorate Our Servant Job. Behold he cried to his Lord: "The Evil One has afflicted me with distress and suffering!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And remember Our slave Ayub (Job), when he invoked his Lord (saying): "Verily! Shaitan (Satan) has touched me with distress (by losing my health) and torment (by losing my wealth)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Also, remember Our worshiper Job. He called out to his Lord, (saying): 'satan has afflicted me with harm and pain'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And mention Our servant Job, when he called out to his Lord, “Satan has afflicted me with hardship and pain.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And remember Our servant Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, Satan has touched me with hardship and torment."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:41] And mention also Our servant Job, when he called out to his Lord, [saying], ‘Lo! Satan has afflicted me with hardship, harm, and suffering’, pain: he attributes all this to Satan, even though all things are from God, to show reverence [in his call] to Him, exalted be He.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And make mention (0 Muhammad) of Our bondman) mention to the disbelievers of Mecca the event of Our bondman (Job, when he cried) when he prayed (unto his Lord (saying): Lo! the devil doth afflict me) I am 524 afflicted because You set Satan on me (with distress) toil and tiredness (and torment) trial and sickness.
